messages: 3d561cb1a9e95bded6c3caa500563d06 (02:02): ahhh! someone help meh... my linux wont use the mouse... i did some online updates, and now mouse dont work... how do i install backup made?

b9ff38622b888abf934e0ea662ec229b (02:06): PiTT, if want to use file transfer without problems, gaim. If you use MSN only, try aMSN
a2522dbd61d69750dce3b6f11ad56e4b (02:07): i use AIM, MSN, ICQ
ddce75f2592f5aab88da246617da2599 (02:07): should give you a terminal

3d561cb1a9e95bded6c3caa500563d06 (02:08): the_dude: it put me at login

a2522dbd61d69750dce3b6f11ad56e4b (02:10): cb400f: how familiar are you with SMART?
a2522dbd61d69750dce3b6f11ad56e4b (02:10): sicne u helped me a lot the other day =)
a2522dbd61d69750dce3b6f11ad56e4b (02:10): i did a update with smart, but its not updating my xgl/compiz
e8b1328caea8ee5e2956469a5b76ff49 (02:11): PiTT: is there an update available?
a2522dbd61d69750dce3b6f11ad56e4b (02:12): cb400f: well the version of xgl on my system is a bit outdated
a2522dbd61d69750dce3b6f11ad56e4b (02:12): there is a newer one, but smart doesn't see it
a2522dbd61d69750dce3b6f11ad56e4b (02:12): even though the channel is listed in my smart
e8b1328caea8ee5e2956469a5b76ff49 (02:12): PiTT: have you added the update channel?
ddce75f2592f5aab88da246617da2599 (02:12): flyman: make sure the mouse is plugged in fully
e8b1328caea8ee5e2956469a5b76ff49 (02:12): have you updated that channel?
e8b1328caea8ee5e2956469a5b76ff49 (02:13): PiTT: do you use gui or shell?
3d561cb1a9e95bded6c3caa500563d06 (02:13): the_dude: I checked, and it is...
3d561cb1a9e95bded6c3caa500563d06 (02:13): would the mouse be called msc?
e8b1328caea8ee5e2956469a5b76ff49 (02:14): PiTT: sounds very strange.. File > update selected channels > choose to update /update/10.1
e8b1328caea8ee5e2956469a5b76ff49 (02:15): PiTT: then under "view" select "hide non-upgrades" and under tree-style select "none"
3d561cb1a9e95bded6c3caa500563d06 (02:15): the_dude: it did some stuff but nothing returned
e8b1328caea8ee5e2956469a5b76ff49 (02:16): PiTT: are you using the repos Guru set up? .. or are you using some bizarre russian mirror assigned by SuseRegister?
a2522dbd61d69750dce3b6f11ad56e4b (02:16): the ones that guru set up
2a3818f29191e51f3da7835635cb304b (02:16): howto force remove an uninstalled package?
085d0ef73c9628c5407729e1bc9ad7a1 (02:16): flyman: what is mouse device pointing to in your xorg.conf
3d561cb1a9e95bded6c3caa500563d06 (02:16): nXOR: I hit enter and its just doing the blinking underscore and no return yet
085d0ef73c9628c5407729e1bc9ad7a1 (02:17): flyman: try moving ur mouse when u cat /dev/input/mice
3d561cb1a9e95bded6c3caa500563d06 (02:17): nXOR: no idea... how do i check? I never opend that before
a2522dbd61d69750dce3b6f11ad56e4b (02:17): cb400f: odd now nothing can be found when i do a search
085d0ef73c9628c5407729e1bc9ad7a1 (02:18): when u move your mouse after cat /dev/input/mice
e8b1328caea8ee5e2956469a5b76ff49 (02:18): PiTT: that's because you're hiding non upgrades
e8b1328caea8ee5e2956469a5b76ff49 (02:18): PiTT: no upgrades are available then
3d561cb1a9e95bded6c3caa500563d06 (02:18): but its been working all up untill i rebooted
e8b1328caea8ee5e2956469a5b76ff49 (02:18): PiTT: but you can try starting zen-updater and zmd and check if it finds any updates
085d0ef73c9628c5407729e1bc9ad7a1 (02:18): maybe its a hardware related issue
